p: We developed a simple model to hypothetically model the short distance dispersal of B. zonata by natural means using the Gaussian probability density function to estimate infestation probability. The following assumptions were considered in building the model: (1) that the host plants of B. zonata were available throughout the year; (2) the current occurrence records of B. zonata were the potential source of infestations to its surrounding areas; (3) there were no major barriers limiting the spread of the pest, and that its probability of spread occurred equally in all directions from the source locations; (4) the pest spreads naturally by flying from one location to another in search of suitable host plants; and (5) the pest spreads from its source location with infestation probability decreasing as a function of distance following a normal curve. The following equation for the Gaussian probability density function (3) was used.
